row.entry: Lists towns with their chiefs & number of warriors
New Map of N. & S. Carolina & Georgia
Shows Indian territories east of the Mississippi
Mant’s “History of the War in America”
Only known copy in any Tennessee collection
Map of the States of Va, N.C., S.C. & Ga
Shows “Country of Frankland” in E. Tennessee
Map of the States of Va., N.C., S.C., & Ga.
Shows “Country of Frankland” in E. Tennessee
Map of the Tennassee Government (state) formerly Part of N.C.
General Atlas for Carey’s “Edition of Gutherie’s Geography Improved”
Map of the State of Kentucky; with Adjoining Territories
Shows Tennessee as the Southwest Territory with areas “Reserved for the N.C. Troops”
Joseph Scott’s “The U.S. Gazetteer: An Atlas of the United States”
Mero District shown “Nash ville and “Tennassee” River located

J. Reid, L. Wagland, & C. Smith
A Map of the State of Kentucky and the Tennessee Government
A Map of Tennassee State formerly part of North Carolina
Carey’s “American Edition of Guthrie’s Geography Improved”
A Topographical Description of the Western Territory of N. America
Author: Gilbert Imlay Format is a book.
Map of the Southern Parts of the U.S. of America
A Map of the Tennassee Govt. from the latest Surveys
“A New & Complete System of Universal Geography”
The State of Kentucky with the adjoining Territories
Facsimile of map done for A.W. Putnam’s “History of Middle Tennessee”?
Shows East and Middle Tennessee as the State of Cumberland and West Tennessee, Alabama & Mississippi as the State of Tennessee
A Map of the Tennassee Govt. from The Surveys
Last of the series of maps based on Daniel Smith’s surveys in 1794
Revised from the map of Tennessee published in “Carey’s General Atlas” in 1814, 1815, and 1816
Map of Kentucky and Tennessee Compiled from the Latest Authorities
Includes table of censuses, ending in 1820. Map folds out of leather binding.
Geographical, Statistical and Historical Map of Tennessee
Carey & Lea’s “A Complete Historical, Chronological and Geographical American Atlas”
Includes text at bottom with information about the state
Morse’s “Atlas of the United States on an Improved plan”
Geographischstatistische und historische Charte von Tennessee
Based on a map of Tennessee in Carey & Lea’s “Complete, Historical, Chronologic al and Geographic al American Atlas” published in 1822
Map of Kentucky and Tennessee Compiled from the latest Authorities
Map of Kentucky and Tennessee Compiled from the latest Authorities
Flint’s “Geography & History of the Western States”
Includes statistical table. Backed on linen
Map of the States of Kentucky and Tennessee
Map of the States of Kentucky and Tennessee
Baird’s “View of the Valley of the Mississippi”
Map of the Cumberland River From The Falls to Nashville
“Report on The Improvement of that Stream for the navigation ot is by Steam Boat”
Survey and Map of the Cumberland River from Cowan’s Shoals to Bartlett’s Creek Island
Howard Stansbury, John P. Bailey and George O’Driscoll
“United States Congress: A Collection of Maps, etc..”
Map of the Coal Formation in Tennessee
Troost was the state geologist of Tennessee
A New Map of Tennessee With Its Roads and Distances
“Illustrated Altas of the United States and Adjacent Countries”
Geological Map of Cocke County, East Tenn.
“5th Geological Report to the General Assembly of Tennessee”
Fifth Geological Report to the Twenty-Third General Assembly of Tennessee
Author: Gerard Troost. Housed in a folder
“4th Report to the State of Tennessee”
A New Map of Tennessee With Its Roads and Distances
Insets of Nashville and Knoxville. Includes table to Steam Boat Routes
Sixth Geological Report to the Twenty-Fourth General Assembly of the State of Tennessee
C.C. Norvell and W.F. Bang and Co.
Includes Geological Map of Sevier County by G. Troost. Author: Gerard Troost. Housed in a folder.
Insets of Nashville and Knoxville. Mounted on linen.
Die Colonie Neu- Bamberg im Staate Tennessee in Nord Amerika
Drud und Berlag des Literarifich & Artifchen Instituts
Pamphlet relating to a proposed colony near where Dickson, Tennessee stands. Housed in a folder.
Shows stage and steam boat routes. Insets of Environs of Nashville and Knoxville.
A New Map of Tennessee With Its Roads and Distances
County Map of Kentucky and Tennessee
A New Map of Tennessee With Its Roads and Distances
Nashville City and Business Directory, for 1860-1861
Includes black and white street map of Nashville.
Panorama of the Seat of War. Bird’s Eye View of Kentucky and Tennessee Showing Cairo and Part of the Southern States
Tables showing distance from Cairo to several locations. Panorama showing rivers, cities, forts and landscapes.

Ink on oilcloth. Shows Confederate signal stations, depots, etc… from Franklin to Shelbyville. Sayers was Captain and Chief Engineer, Polk’s Corps, CSA. Map was drawn at Hdqtrs. Engineer’s Dept. Shelbyville, May 6, 1863.
Civil War Map of Area Around Shiloh and Corinth, Mississippi
Rough Plan of part of Battle of Waukatchie, Tenn.
Drawn from memory by H.T., presumably a Union soldier.
Map of Northern Georgia and Tennessee
Inset of Chattanooga and vicinity. Confederate imprint.
County Map of Kentucky and Tennessee
Map of The State of Kentucky and Part of Tennessee
Colton’s map of the State of Tennessee 1870
Map was drawn in the post-Civil War period
Gray’s New Map of Kentycky and Tennessee

Insets showing system of railroads, comparative increases in population, hypsometric sketck of the two states, and density of population. Reverse side shows maps of Cincinnati, Indianapolis and Louisville
Special Report on The Coal-Field of Little Sequatchie
Author of pamphlet is J.B. Killebrew. Includes map of the Little Sequatchie Coalfields
Middle Tennessee as an Iron Center
Author is J.B. Killebrew. Includes map of iron deposits. Killebrew was Commissioner of Agriculture, Statistics and Mines and Immigration, for the State of Tennessee
Map Showing Part of the Iron Field West of Nashville
Biennial Report of the President of Fire and Police Commissioners of the Taxing District (Memphis) Shelby County, Tennessee, to the Governor of The State
“Coast and Geodetic Survey Reports for 1880 & 1881”, no. 27
County Map of Kentucky and Tennessee
Railroad and County Map of Kentucky and Tennessee
Insets showing engraved sketches of the State Capitol, the Memphis Navy Yard , and the Entrance to the Mammoth Cave
County Map of Kentucky and Tennessee
Map of the Former Territorial Limits of the Cherokee “Nation of” Indians
“5th. Annual Report, Smithsonian Institution Bureau of Ethnology”
Includes table showing Numeric and Chronologic Schedules of Cherokee Cessions
Plan of the City of Nashville and Vicinity

Panorama showing individual buildings, many of which are identified at bottom. Insets show Nashville Iron, Steel & Charcoal Co.; National Manufacturing Co.; Tennessee Range & Manufacturing Co.; West Nashville; D.H. Baldwin & Co. Pianos & Organs
From survey of W.T. & A.S. Kelley, Civil Engineers. Includes engraved sketch of the Angle Court Hotel. A large town plan for the proposed town of Kimball
Pamphlet promoting a proposed twon in East Tennessee
Office of the Inspector General of Fortifications, Z.B. Tower, U.S. Engineers, Military Division of Mississippi
“Atlas to Accompany the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies, 1861-1865”
Shows defense plans for Battery Erwin, Battery Coolidge, Battery for Casino Hill, the Capitol, Fort Dan McCook, Fort Morton, Fort Sill, Fort W.D. Whipple, and Redoubt for Hill No. 210
Map of Nashville: Guide to the City
Soil Survey of Dickson County Tennessee
U.S. Department of Agriculture Bureau of Soils in Cooperation With the Tennessee Geological Survey
Authors are J.A. Kerr, H.G. Lewis, W.J. Latimer and E.H. Bailey
Soil Map of Tennessee Dickson County Sheet
J.A. Kerr, H.G. Lewis, W.J. Latimer, E.H. Bailey
U.S. Department of Agriculture Bureau of Soils in Cooperation with the Tennessee Geological Survey
Soil Survey of Dickson County, Tennessee is also in collection (no. 101)
Complete Map of Nashville Wards & Suburbs
Mid- Twentieth century. Street names are indexed
Southern Provinces of The United States
Inset shows “Characteristic Scenery of the Hudson River.” Georgia includes Alabama and Mississippi
Eastern Cherokees in North Carolina. Letter from the Secretary of the Interior In Response to Resolution of The House
Agricultural and Geological Map of Tennessee
Shows topographic al features, railroads, county boundaries, county towns, etc…
Map of the States of Kentucky and Tennessee
Map Prepared to exhibit The Campaigns in which The Army of the Cumberland Took Part During The War of The Rebellion
Edward Ruger, A. Kilp and R. Flack
“Atlas to Accompany the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies, 1861-1865”
Includes maps illustrating the operations of the 7th Division at Cumberland Gap and the Environs of Petersburg, Va.
Plan of Fort Des Ecores at Margot
Contains maps of Cherokee reservations in North Carolina
Map of the Cherokee Nation Indian Territory
“Eighth Annual Report, Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes”
